segments.text: I'm just standing here, watching everything unfold.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The water from the faucet is truly gushing into the sink.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It's already overflowing, spilling right over the edge.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: A stream cascades down the cabinet doors, forming a growing puddle.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The woman, however, seems completely lost in her task.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: She's meticulously drying that plate, utterly unaware of the flood at her feet.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Her expression is so calm, it's almost eerie.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: One of her feet is already submerged in the water on the floor.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: How can she not feel that cold water soaking her shoe?
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It's quite astonishing how oblivious she is to the immediate danger.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: This water is going to cause some serious damage to the cabinets.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Someone really needs to turn that tap off before the whole kitchen is ruined.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The contrast with the tidy garden outside is just too much.
segments.speaker: PAR
